channel.title: Nature on The Outsider's Journey
channel.description: Recent content in Nature on The Outsider's Journey

item.title: SVL 1.7: Mount Madonna, Davenport Beach, San Francisco, Yosemite
item.description: 4th September 2014 Â Hi, Here is the next update about our recent travels and experiences. Â This email is long (â€˜megalangâ€™) and itâ€™s taken me all day to upload and organise the pictures and write it out.

item.title: SVL 1.4: The Great Outdoors and Indoors
item.description: After I wrote to you the previous time, we went out and went to DeeDees, a Gujarati restaurant for dinner. Just near where we parked, I took these pictures.

item.title: SVL 1.2: Two weeks in the USA
item.description: 2nd July 2014 Hello everyone, Today I took the driversâ€™ written test and passed with flying colours. I got all answers correct! I studied hard for the last couple of days although I was preparing using videos even sometime last week.

item.title: Sunnyvale Letters (SVL) 1: Wedding and After
item.description: June 21st 2014 Happy Summer Solstice everyone! ðŸ™‚ I woke up at 5am because of jetlag and my husband, Santosh, is still sleeping. Iâ€™ve been wanting to write every day of the last month but things have been so busy.

item.title: Azhage Azhagu: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a translation of a recent song from a movie called Saivam that my mum recommended I listen to. I listened to it last night and fell in love with the voice.

item.title: LOG 4.1: Thoughts on a rainy afternoon
item.description: 14th September 2013 Hello everyone, I live close to the Uni so my daily space is very small. But recently I have visited my old flatmate Lea in Bremen once for dinner and once for their housewarming party.

item.title: LOG 3.7 Of rain and coming home
item.description: 19th June 2013 The sound, smell and sight of a storm are reassuring and comforting to me. I sit here thousands of miles away listening to Ghanana ghanana from Lagaan for a moment transported to Bangalore.

item.title: Starry night
item.description: The stars are so pure in their brightness tonight. No earthly sources of light can begin to compare. Sirius sparkled in a clean and loud tone as the others seemed to harmonise in the music of the galaxy.

item.title: A sunbeam child
item.description: Written in August, 2013 Smells of magnified burnt leaves Light tinges of Jasmine The Sun is beautiful, the grass so green The bee patiently collects nectar

item.title: Feel good links
item.description: Iâ€™d like to share here some of the interesting links Iâ€™ve read recently: This oneis the less covered story about ordinary and good Indian men. After all the nasty stories weâ€™ve read, this comes as a breath of fresh air and points out all the nice qualities Indian man have.

item.title: LOG 3.1: Summer Solstice
item.description: 21st June, 2012 Happy Summer Solstice everyone ðŸ™‚ It has been two weeks since I got back to Germany from India. All the trees grew back their leaves in the month I was gone so everything looks and feels alive!

item.title: LOG 2.2: Photos of the Neighbourhood
item.description: 25th September 2011 Hello! Here are some photos of the neighbourhood. We went for a walk today after Marenâ€™s Birthday-cake party. Maren is my flatmateâ€™s girlfriend.

item.title: Thoughts about going Vegan
item.description: I was raised vegetarian and my family has been vegetarian for generations. When I was thirteen or fourteen, my parents told me that since I will be travelling when I get older, I could start getting used to meat if I wanted to.

item.title: LOG 1.22 Boats :)
item.description: 12th July, 2011 Hello, I hope all of you have been well. Life has improved significantly for me since I organised it. I now feel like I have a sense of purpose and

item.title: LOG 1.20: Chickens and Seals
item.description: 13th June, 2011 Hello everyone, Itâ€™s been half a year since I left home the second time and luckily I will be back home for some time without as much gap as last time.

item.title: LOG 1.19: Sunsets
item.description: 2nd June, 2011 Hello, This will be a short one. MATLAB week is going surprisingly well and Iâ€™m learning a lot without getting frustrated. Only tomorrow left and I find that it has been an easier one than most others.

item.title: LOG 1.18: A friend visits
item.description: 31st May, 2011 Hello, Hope this finds all of you in good health and happiness. Today I had the first day of a MATLAB workshop which will last all week except Thursday which is a holiday for us.

item.title: LOG 1.17: Oh wow, Barcelona!
item.description: 11th May, 2011 Ola everyone ðŸ™‚ I have successfully recovered to a state of normalcy after the most amazing and exhausting weekend I can ever remember having!

item.title: LOG 1.16: Barcelona on my mind
item.description: 5th May, 2011 Hello, Tonight I sleep in Bremen Airport to be on time for a very early morning flight to Barcelona where I will meet two of my close friends from my year in Edinburgh â€¦ it will be one of their birthdays during the weekend when we will be there and we will be staying with the kind hospitality of the otherâ€™s brother.

item.title: LOG 1.14: A Trip to GÃ¶ttingen
item.description: 10th April, 2011 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I just returned from a trip to GÃ¶ttingen where my flatmates and I celebrated an old flatmateâ€™s birthday. We took a train yesterday morning and I was quite taken in by the beauty of the countryside.

item.title: Spiritual, religious or philosophical?
item.description: Many people confuse spirituality with religiousness, and philosophy with spirituality. Here I will attempt to tease out the differences as I see them. To be religious is to follow a given set of rules generally defined by an existing system of organised faith.

item.title: LOG 1.12: DMT, The Discovery of Dro"gen Hasen Weg and the Super Extreme Moon
item.description: 18th March, 2011 Hello everyone, I watched this video recently. http://www.esoterictube.com/dmt-the-spirit-molecule.htmlIt corresponds with what Joseph Campbell says about the spiritual world (as represented by myths and anecdotes from those who meditate, and shamans), drugs and psychological diseases like schizophrenia.

item.title: Autumn dance
item.description: It is time for leaves to bid farewell to the trees they leave Where they have lived for two happy seasons Leaving is an elation

item.title: LOG 1.10: The first signs
item.description: 28th February, 2011 Hello, It is now possible to see the first signs of Spring. The trees are bearing buds that will leaf and flower forth.

item.title: LOG 1.5: Snow, it turns to rain
item.description: 15th January, 2011 Hello everyone, It has been a while since I last wrote. Iâ€™ve been busy seeing houses, working (:O ! :)), and going out with friends.

item.title: About Life and Death
item.description: From August 2008 We assume Immortality. Only a death of someone close to us reminds us of our Impermanence. We make promises and think of ways to make our lives more meaningful, now that weâ€™ve experienced this reminder.

item.title: Suhani Raat Dhal Chuki: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a soothing, sweet, romantic Hindi song from the 1949. **Suhani Raat Dhal Chuki, Na Jaane Tum Kab Aaoge, Jahan Ki Rut Badal Chuki, Na Jaane Tum Kab Aaoge,**

item.title: LOG 1.4: Beauty and the Beasts
item.description: 30th December, 2010 Hello everyone, Another â€˜Old Yearâ€™ has gone by â€¦ well I hope it was as happy as it couldâ€™ve been for everyone. So many things have happened, so many new things have been learnt!

item.title: Letters from Oldenburg, Germany 1.1: And so it Begins!
item.description: 6th December, 2010 Hello All!! Winter is a strange season to start a new thing anywhere. Mainly because places seem most uninhabitable in this season. But here I am, sitting in mz new office, struggling with ?

item.title: Goodbye Edinburgh, Hello Oldenburg
item.description: This is the beginning of a new series of letters I have sent home. It starts three months after my last letter from Edinburgh when I was about to leave for India.

item.title: Â´Unlucky knock on woodÂ´ by C.K. Meena
item.description: C.K. Meena is a columnist in The Hindu, one of IndiaÂ´s biggest news papers. She was my teacher when I took up a certificate course in Journalism and we soon became friends.

item.title: A Glimpse of Summer
item.description: Full green trees Soft summer breeze Ripe Nectarines Nectarines invite With fruity fragrance Tempt a juicy bite The grass is deep Big boys play A whiff to keep

item.title: Reflections on God 7: Current Beliefs
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Views on other beliefs I retain a relatively moderate view on people who take an external god literally, so long as they never cross the line of violence especially with children, nature or other cultures.

item.title: Reflections on God 6: Radical Atheism
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Radical Atheism After almost a year of intense email exchanges about god with my friend in Sydney, I went to Edinburgh for my Masters in Neuroscience.

item.title: Reflections on God 5: Yoga
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Yoga I took up Yoga classes in the holidays between my BSc and MSc mainly to address a back problem I had developed by using a tilted chair.

item.title: Reflections on God 4: Hindu Mythology and Philosophy
item.description: This is part of God Flux butÂ split into smaller sections for an easier read. Ka, Doniger, Joseph Campbell Before entering the waters of atheism again, let me mention the other influences I had during and a little after my undergraduate years.

item.title: Reflections on God 3: The Other Cheek of Christianity
item.description: This is part of God Flux but split into smaller sections for an easier read. The other cheek of Christianity During my undergraduate course, I joined the choir and sang songs praising Jesus.

item.title: Reflections on God 2: Deep Ecology and Buddhism
item.description: This is part of God Flux but written in smaller sections for an easier read. Compassion So I put together my own version of god. Almost an imaginary friend.

item.title: Home Remedies from south India: Skin care
item.description: *â€™Hair bathâ€™ is a term used in colloquial Indian English (Indianism) which means having a regular bath as well as washing oneâ€™s hair. Many people donâ€™t wash their hair every day.

item.title: LfE 24: Volcano Sunset
item.description: 20/04/2010 Â Hello, As you all probably know, the Iceland Volcano continues to erupt disrupting flights all over northern Europe. My flatmate who was supposed to go to Germany for part of her PhD has been grounded here.

item.title: LfE 21: Season of Lifeâ€¦ Under my Skin
item.description: 03/03/2010 Hello everyone, Iâ€™m halfway through my stay here in Edinburgh and every day brings me closer to the day I can come back home to Bangalore and hug my family.

item.title: Nadiye Nadiye Kadhal Nadiye: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: The movie Rhythm has themed songs on the various elements of nature. This one is on water. The lyrics draw a comparisons between the qualities of women and and of water.

item.title: On a Snowy morning
item.description: When I was 7 and I was about to fly to Australia, I told my grandparents that I will bring some clouds back with me for them.

item.title: The Woman
item.description: She is the wind you cannot capture, the fire you cannot hold, She has the strength of the earth but she flows She is a woman.

item.title: For Now
item.description: October 2008 This yellow evening, Winds tell of rains to come. A healthy, happy wind That I havenâ€™t felt for so long. Dry mango leaves

item.title: Written in the moonlight
item.description: From May 2008 For too long I have absorbed. Here in this moonlight. I still see colour. I breathe. I create. There is no romantic breeze

item.title: Anger
item.description: First published in August 2008 Anger. Like a vengeful human on a leash If you were to be freed What damage, what destructionâ€¦ What chaos.

item.title: Misty Night
item.description: On this misty night Trees are backlit mystically She cannot welcome Winter with any warmth Yet, when you are near The biting wind is forgiven

item.title: This Pebble
item.description: First published on 24th October, 2006 This Pebble; Pure while at heart but a tinge of brown outside. Smooth, but for a few cracks through which the blankness

item.title: Missing Mountains
item.description: First published in September 2007 . This prison. Walls. No trees. No where to hide To be alone or cry. No one to understand the loverâ€™s yearning for the mountains

item.title: Flakes
item.description: Written in Feb 2007 The season changes Clouds cover parts of The sky. I lose peace. Moisture in the wind Falling leaves; dry and Brittle. Wait for rain.

item.title: The Amazon and us
item.description: First published on August 12, 2007 _â€œIn the time it takes to sing this song, Thereâ€™ll be four acres cleared in the Amazon. The jungle burns all through the night,

item.title: Earth
item.description: June 5th 2008: There is vulnerability In the bud, and Small new leaves. In all young, Newborns sprouting Into Life. There is freshness in Water- life-giving

item.title: Letters from Edinburgh: 2
item.description: **13/09/2009 THE BEGINNING: PART 2** Hello! I just got back from a great time at three events. I climbed Arthurâ€™s Seat and made a friend (Greek) whoâ€™s about to start studying Bachelors of Computer science and met a Londoner who studies Geology.

item.title: Android body vs Human body
item.description: A lot of futuristic science fiction puts forward several ideas of what an android would be like. Data from Star Trek (TNG) is an intriguing character who tries very hard to understand what it is to be human.

item.description: Four plums on my table Dark red and ripe. Sweet and juicy. I also have chocolate cream biscuits In the shelf The sun will rise soon and

item.title: Pure White Snow
item.description: What colour is love? What temperature is it? I feel it in the fractal flakes And the warm bedroom light

item.title: Autumn Garden
item.description: However dim the light, The leaves glow bright In the Autumn Garden Almost as if they had a light of their own Golden yellow, orange

item.title: Ode to the Apple
item.description: Oh, Symbol of material Love, The â€˜Appleâ€™ of my eye, Your cold, mountain fragrance, Red beauty, Temptation, By you, we were separated from Eden. Peaceful, wholesome, godly Eden.
